reviewText:
If you like flying airplanes then you will most likely love this game. like others have mentioned , the game has a steep learning curve and aside of love of flying , it takes patience and willingness to learn before you get to enjoy flying. but then the experience is really rewarding. if you really love flying then you will also love the learning process. now in my book there are 3 types of fans when it comes to flying games . lets see ...

1- the first type only want to grab the stick (or keyboard) and start shooting down bandits and bombing ground targets without having to mess with anything else. if you are from this type then go for battlefield series , HAWX or War Thunder..etc. don't bother with DCS . you will have hours of fun with the other titles that I mentioned. and trust me , there are some really good ones out there and I've personally tried most of them .

2- This type of fans love flying and don't mind getting into some details about planes but they don't want to get too deep with all aspects of flight mechanics and details. if you belong in this category , look up Flaming cliffs 3" on steam and leave it on a tab and then continue reading.

3- These are plane nerds. they want to know what all the instruments and buttons do in an airplane. they want to get a realistic experience of flying and have no problems putting time and effort to learn so. if you belong in this category then why the hell are you still reading ? go download DCS and have fun . thank me later.


Now ... if you are the first type ... don't bother with DCS. there are tons of other titles that will bring you hours of fun. DCS is for the other 2 types .

if you love flying but don't want to go too deep into anything other than basic flight mechanics
date: then you're in the right place. DCS has "non-clickable cockpits" in different planes where you don't have to know what every single switch does. you just have to memorize a few keyboard shortcuts and have a basic knowledge of reading the instruments which is really easy if you're willing to do so . you will get to feel how a real plane flies without having to dig into books to be able to start your aircraft. BUT here is the thing. you can by FC3 and get so many planes at a decent price . if you go for DCS you will have to buy each plane separately (expect for the 2 included in the free version) . the choice is up to you. but KEEP reading .\n\nFinally if you are from the last type
recommended: then you just have to grab your stick

reviewText:
This is an incredibly fun simulator.  The Free Su-25T alone will keep you occupied for many hours as you learn the ins and outs of flying like a real pilot.  Every switch, every knob, every lever can be operated in some way.  Everything visible in the cockpit works and every dial is accurate.  On very high-end machines, in screenshots, it's hard to tell it's a simulator and not real at first glance at the cockpit detail.

Recently, I purchased the Flaming Cliffs 3 DLC package as well, as the F-15C is amazingly more fun than the Su-25T.  Haven't even had a chance to try out the various MiGs or even roll out the A-10A.

If you even remotely like games involving flight, this is one you should try out.  Play the training missions, make a couple practice ones, and practice, practice, practice.  It's an incredibly fun and challenging experience learning how to fly these aircraft.

DCS World is amazing.

reviewText:
Best sim ever!!! Got into this sim when I saw a DCS: A-10C module on a 75% sale, and decided to give it a try.

In the beginning, it was a big frustration. The learning curve was steep and the tutorials were too few and not very helpful. Imagine learning to swim with a float for 15min and then being thrown into the sea without any aid. Decided to give up within 3 days of purchase.

Eventually I began to sit down, listen to the tutorials, take notes, view videos and check out the eagledynamics forum for beginner's tips.

Took me a month before I was able to employ the guided munitions on ground targets, another month to practise taking out multiple targets in a single pass, and yet another month to effectively use the GAU-8 gun and CBUs. All that done with a trusty gamepad and the good 'ol keyboard. Picked up a Saitek x52 after a while and it's the only game that I enjoy besides Total War.

After a year, and I'm dodging SAM missles in an A-10C and started larning to fly the F-15, SU-27, SU-25 and MIG-29. Not a pro, yet able to be an effective threat.

Pros:

1) Great detail and modelling of the aircrafts and weapons (literally see the animation of weapon deployment in every single detail).

2) Great graphics and atmosphere (night landings and combat are a real challenge)

3) Decent third-party support (tutorials, missions and mods)

4) Huge map

5) Fun multiplayer

6) Sandbox-style fight sim

7) New learning experience on every mission.

Cons:

1) Bad optimization (choppy framerates)

2) Limited modern jets

3) Limited tutorials and missions

4) Feels like the whole game is in beta at times

reviewText:
(WARNING, this is not a Video game as Battlefield, War Thunder and so on, it's a Combat Simulator. You will need to have at least a proper Joystick for this to be enjoyable. I let a friend borrow mine and I tried to play without it... That didn't go so weary well)

Okey, for god sake Steam, put in a button so I can have between like and disslike... So I don't have to sit and have this dilemma to thumb up or down. After 15min I gave it up

The entire simulator itself is just... Magic, I never knew that a aircraft simulator when I can look around in the cockpit and and pull, press, and switch on everything and it actually DO SOMETHING, existed!!! I'm not sure you can find anything better then this that both looks good, sound good, and with so much details, and the feel when I fly... Words can not describe how wonderfull this is.


I only have one problem, and I both understand and not undstand why. And that is the price to buy the other aircrafts. Fine, if we say this newly released MiG for 44,99£ that's acceptable for my part.

But when this 3 year old airplane cost as much, just no. Put down the price a little Plz. Maybe put down the price on one jet would be fine so those that is new to this and can actually put in maybe 25£ or even 30£ to give this Simualtor a try out for something different would be really nice. If they really enjoy it, I don't doupt they will buy the rest after. I will get the Huey later that's for sure when I can already see how wonderfull this simulator is with details, but that's me, don't be so sure if other will think the same. I think that could help.


Other thing I hope will happen, but it doesn't bother me, but could be a nice thing:

-See my body in the airplane and he stretch his arm to press or switch (and i'm talking about an option you can turn on and off to have this) (PS. I just found that it's a thing, don't know how I missed that)

-The ground people and my pilot when he bail out to have some proper animations when they walk, I mean, the animation is really awkward.

-when I turn the camera when I see from the pilot view when I bail out that he to move his head, I don't think that should be much of a problem to fix, by the thought of how many other things they done.

-It could be fun if the aircraft didn't just turn into a pile of nothing when it crash hard, it could just be fun for the enjoyment to be in the big crash when the aircraft flips around and slide over the ground when you make that enormous crash to the ground. Specially if I fly a jet in high speed and slowly get the belly of the plane closer and closer to the ground, and then just BOOM! I turn into nothing on the ground but smoke.

-Maybe the things that is stationed on the ground could have some physics to? First time I tried to start from the ground, my right wing hit the stationed Helicopter, and that Heli was hard as a mountain. I don't ask for something super advanced, just that it maybe could move or something.


I have some more, but eeh, getting to long now, those are the most important" if I can name it so when it comes to those details. It might see as nitpicking
date:
but it could make this simulator more immersive if you know what I mean.


Other then that

reviewText:
After years of developping still there is no save option for mission so players can not built more complicated missions or campagins. There is no dynamic campagin

If you wana to have fun with formation flying things like that buy it.
If you count that you  can play complicated missions, capturing towns, airfields, something like battlefield or ARMA but on simulation level (what would be nice), dont buy it. Because nobody has not made such a mission on campagin but it is posible to make-devs dont care about it

Its a good game, nice looking, phisics is also on very good level you need to spend some teens of hours to learn how to fly and fight that is realy nice. Almost everything is very good here except of one thing.
Digital Combat Simulator can not simulate big military operations, MMO etc. It offers tanks, artilaery, planes, helicopters, ships, AWACS, EWR, AA and many many more + posibility to take comand over vehicles/groups or even drive them but for what? there is no dynamic campagin. In multipalyer guys has crafted some good missions but they are concentrated mostly on PVPing on air than on gound that cooperation (but it should be opposite because it real planes only support military operations but the most important ground forces are). DCS has few misions built in, if you want more you have mission editor, then everything you have to built self!!!  If you got bored of PVPing or formation flying then you have to become a GAME DEVELOPER and spend thousends of hours to create good mission/campagin to play (like me, I spend more time in editor than in air/ground). To built something good on good level you need to spend houndreds of hours to create mission, I will not tell about dynamic campagin (some thousends hours).
Developpers dont planing to make online dynamic campagin (join/leave when you want and choose automaticly generated mission to do in online campagin) but it is posible to create it but they prefer to create new modules for $ then something what is missing for years here. just look here:
over 100 pages...answer from ED? IS not posible due to overstress of PC. It is posible when you make deactivating object witch are not necesery now (players are far). I have implemented over 200 groups and over 4100 objects. Its working. 4200 is unstable.
In my opinion, Its beter for devs to produce more modules for not finished  DCS wrold"

reviewText:
I downloaded and attempted to run this game with the occulus rift.
Boy was that a mistake.

The menu and HUD ignore head tracking, so you can't rebind any of your keys, or even see what they are already bound to because your eyeballs are not meant to see and read text at the very top of your vision. You were meant to move your head so that it enters your field of view.

The game itself is completely unplayable in VR. Everything has its own complicated keybinding ( Ctrl + Shift + Del = turn on power, F5 + num9 + roll your face on the left half of the keyboard is turn power off)
I'm sure plenty of basement dwellers enjoy that kind of immersion but it is COMPLETELY IMPOSSIBLE while you are wearing a VR headset.
Why?
Because you cannot see the keyboard to execute the overly complicated commands.
Duh.

Maybe this is a revolution in gaming. I will never know.
Don't bother with this if you were hoping for an engaging VR experience.

I really wanted to recomend this game however there are certain things that alone would not be make of an issue but as you keep finding them you just want to give up. So at my wits end I cannot recomend this game for these reasons"

reviewText:
overview:
this game is a modern air combat simulation game where you can fly almost carbon copies of real military aircraft from both the us and russia such as
A-10C
F-15C
UH-H1 huey helicopter
SU-25
KA-50 black shark helicopter
even WW2 classics like the P-51D mustang
the graphics are very good as are the weapon effects and damage moddelling
and considering the price tag of over $900 AUD it had better be good

pros:
awesome graphics
semi-realistic weapon effects
highly detailed effects (smoke/fire.etc)
somewhat realistic flight models
decent damage modelling (bits break off when you feel they should such as after a collision)
VR support
good selection of DLC (even though it should be sold in the game as one package)

cons:

*    has a minor effect on playability
**   has a significant effect on playability
*** has an extreme effect on playability
#   no effect on playability but very annoying


*    bullsh*t multiplayer (sign up required)
*** prices that are criminally high ($684.97 USD $907.53 AUD) if you want the full game)
**  online only DRM (for me anyway)
*** uses integrated GPU when launched from steam regardless of the NVIDIA default setting (ATI may be different)
#   forced updates (evil)
#   replay system is buggy (damage/crashes usually dont happen the same way everytime a replay is played back)
#   virtually nonexistant technical support from developers (they dont answer emails/forum posts)


bottom line:
i do not recommend this game due to the extreme price of the full game
maybe if it was around $100 i would definitely reccomend it
but if i had $900 laying around i would have much better things to buy
such as several hours in a real full motion flight training simulator
or a ride in a real fighter jet
or an oculus rift

the company is selling the game piece by piece in a similar way that the worst free to play mobile games do
$20 here $50 there and in the end it all leads to you spending the price of a used car from a dealership on a computer program that will be outdated in a few years anyway

this concludes my review of DCS world
voteText: 9 of 45 people (20%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText:
At first look this game looks amazing, looks like the ultimate flying simulator for flying simulator fans.
the graphics looks amazingly detailed and high quality.
The controls are are detaild down to the cockpit lights, and the opening and closing of the cockpity roof.
At first look this game looks incradible... that is until you find out the amout BUGS in this game.
Game haulting bugs, and bad UX. for example: when trying to finish the tutorials (without them you wont be able to play the game), if you restart the tutorial, the tutorial will get stuck on the instruction. which will make you close the game trough Windows , since there is no other way to close the game when in mission, making you frustrated from all the long loading times you have to go trough. every time you start a mission at the main menu, the game completly shutsdow and opens up the mission instance, i have no idea why they did that like that, but that makes loading time 3x the normal loading times for this kinda game. eventually i was tired of waiting in loading screen, and tired of exiting and entering the game, so i had to uninstall.

I have to say i looked up the solution for the game haulting bugs of this game, and saw no reffence to them except some QA employees telling other people who experienced these bugs that we couldn't replicate it on our computers" excuse
date:
you know... "it worked on my computer". that just show the indifferance of the developers to bugs in the game.
To bad because what could have been maybe the best flight simulator for PC is complitly unplayable due to inefficent QA and bug solving.

All in all - potentially a great game

reviewText:
Without paid modules i do recommend this game. However i cannot recommend this game if you want to drop some money here, there are just too many bugs.

@update

Someone asked to list these bugs and as i replied to him, the list is too long (just check ED forums.....and yes those old ones are still present). Most bugs are already 2-3 years old which means they have never been addressed and since the list keeps growing, the chance of them being solved in mid-short term are really low.

One of these old bugs are so crucial to the game itself that almost kill the game, like weapons performance for both AA and AG specially for AA.


Pro :
- Flight Model
- Vehicle choice

Cons :
- Too bugged
- BVR combats are far from an ok status". No BVR weapon work properly.
- Some AG weapons not working properly

In conclusion
date: the game is perfect for a flight simulator but too many flaws when it is about COMBAT flight simulator."

reviewText: This is a complicated enough game that tutorials are pretty necesary.  I've played complicated sims before like Kamov Hokum, but each has it's own level of detail for targeting/controls so you pretty much need to learn each sim.\n\nThe problem is the tutorials are broken.  The spacebar is used to proceed through the tutorial, but even with the default key mapping I enver changed, it does not work.  Googling found lots of other people with same problem.  I finally found a key mapping that managed to get the tutorial to start, but then later it froze again and nothing I did would get it to proceed.  Seems like the tutorial, something that is very linear, should be easily testable with default control settings, but apperently even after numerous reports from users, they haven't bothered fixing it.

reviewText:
I can not recommend sorry. War Thunder is better for both the beginner and expert. It also has some awesome areal dog fighting.

PROS:
-Nice graphics
-It does the job as a flight sim

CONS:
-Greed. I could never endorse a game which charges over $600 for DLC. I understand the base game is free. However, lets say you purchase the P-51D Mustang. $29.99 invested in the game. Not bad for a flight sim. But for you $30 you can fly 3 planes. Thats it. Pretty poor for a flight sim. Say you want to fly a MIG 21. The game is now an $80 investment. This is simply not good enough. If you want dogfighting go play War Thunder. If you want a better flight sim experience go play FSX or even better...X-Plane.

reviewText:
I downloaded DCS world earlier today, it took a long time to download (around 11 hours) but i was excited to play it because of all of the positive reviews on the store page and because i enjoy plane simulator games. However, after the long wait, i was ready to play the game i had wanted for quite a while, but never had a good enough computer to play, this christmas i bought an NVIDIA GTX 750 TI so that i could run more games on PC, i was excited to play and opened DCS world for the first time, straight away, a small black window, a console window, appeared, after a few seconds it vanished and the game booted up, i adjusted the resolution and put the game onto highest settings, loaded up the free flight mode and then, i was kicked out of the game onto the desktop, after a while it loaded back up and loaded free flight, it kept doing the same thing, once i decided to wait and eventually, free flight loaded.

i couldn't wait to play, i tried to turn the plane, and it went spiralling out of control into the poorly designed, two-dimensional, badly rendered textures of the ground, the plane then exploded. i waited, the game never respawned me, instead i was taken to an airport ingame, and forced to watch a random aeroplane sit still, i tried moving the mouse, pressing keys etc. but nothing would happen, i pressed on Esc and clicked on quit, i was kicked out of the game again for a while, then my entire desktop went black for 5 minutes, i pressed Ctrl+Alt+Delete but DCS would not close, it eventually loaded the game again, and it crashed instantly.

I rate this game 7.5/10, not enough black screens
